channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @RokhlK Not in those words, but the essence of the central teaching of one of Hillel’s most influential contemporaries. https://t.co/Pl896VArpY

@JeffreyWoolf @Wordsmith_Manda @mominisrael Republicans are now arguing that it’s meant to stop a federal church but the states can each create their own.
@JeffreyWoolf @Wordsmith_Manda @mominisrael The current Supreme Court is on a mission to roll back a century of liberal jurisprudence even as the Republican Party aligns with the most haredi forms of Christianity.
@Shmarya @dzkalman Makes me wonder if this outfit is legit. https://t.co/Gcr05P56nC
@RokhlK The problem is that Elchonon Wasserman took his bitachon to the gas chamber, and while his surviving followers try to resurrect it, IMHO that’s just so much Holocaust denialism.
Happy Slaveholder’s Rebellion Day to all those who celebrate. https://t.co/CaYIVMOVzx
@oliver_drk @AtticusGF Yes. But: Note which one of them is currently in the Atlantic’s payroll.
@datadivajf It was amazing to see some of the Evangelical reactions to Bennett forming a government. You’d have thought he was Barack Obama or something.

In fact, Star Trek waited to raise issues like post-combat trauma until the beginning of the fourth minute of its pilot, “The Cage.” https://t.co/1OQ9I2MKBM
Which is not to say that the rest of that episode isn’t problematic in several ways, ranging from a large dollop of early 60s sexism to weird inconsistencies (should “old fashioned radio waves” really jostle a ship in substance?)
But it was the only episode where the crew didn’t have to leave the bridge to get a print-out, so much is forgiven. https://t.co/5nuXtxWbR2
Also, give credit to Roddenberry for make the villains motivated by a desire for…. Exciting television. https://t.co/6MNETKnJaG
@jacksno87587952 @jeremyfcohen @skestenbaum Yes. Can we help with building fund?
@datadivajf Which episode?
@avocados_ai “An Irish Lephrechaun reading from the Torah”
@JewsforWarren @datadivajf 13 Attributes of God. 13 Principles of Faith. 13 Canons of Interpretation. 13 Children of Jacob. 13 Tribes of Israel. 13 Months in a Full Year.
@froomkin More interesting would be to investigate whether the contrarian-to-fascist pipeline has caused any introspection by former professional contrarians.
@bogiperson Just say no to pocketless clothes.

@harryreis @datadivajf @RJC Sorry, Harry. Gotta agree with them this time. When they're right, they're right. Though they neglected to mention that one of ours was his true prophet. https://t.co/0vmRl9TSUk
@EladNehorai @sullydish Glad that she and her ex can at least see eye to eye when it comes to disliking public conversations.
@fmc_dylan Pretty amazing resemblance. https://t.co/E2GXGULHIJ

@EladNehorai This. Humorous retelling of Philosophy 101. https://t.co/IDQN2JLeg4
@EladNehorai My kid loved it at about that age.
@DavidBrin More galaxies — but they’re small enough to not impact the estimated number of stars out there.

@todddberman @leslie_g_klein @EladNehorai Yep. Which ended up with the remaining inventory in my New Jersey basement following the lawsuit. (Trivia: I led Adon Olam at one of the author’s bar mitzvah.)
@drvolts Source of the Paragraph?
@MsEntropy True of North Korea too. I don’t understand why people say it as if it’s a good thing.

@EladNehorai The problem is that the two thirds of the senate needed to convict isn’t going to happen unless a third of the Republicans turn against them. And then the ignorant will consider him innocent.
@trekonomics Crazy. So “feathered dinosaurs” is a redundancy. Dinosaurs are by definition those things with feathers.

“Empires are designed to subjugate us. And as they do so, it is our job to stay grounded in the knowledge that the queer project of the Rabbis has always been one of resistance and refusal to relegate our autonomy to the whims of imperial rule.” https://t.co/zt1lxVqlUW
— Laynie Soloman, Associate Rosh Yeshiva of https://t.co/BEUiaWZg1X, discusses Talmud and law as American law is retooled once again into a handmaiden of oppression.
